words.definition: an opinion you give someone about what he or she should do
words.meaning: Birine ne yapması gerektiği hakkında verilen fikir
examples: My grandmother gave me some great advice about saving money.
I always ask my mentor for advice on my career.

words.meaning: Bir kişinin genellikle eğitim aldıktan sonra uzun süre yaptığı iş türleri
words.definition: the kinds of work people do, usually after learning how and usually for a long time
examples: She is considering a career in engineering.
Many people change careers several times in their lifetime.

words.meaning: Birine iş vermek
words.definition: to give someone a job
examples: The company plans to hire 10 new employees next month.
We need to hire a new accountant.

words.meaning: Mükemmel, en uygun
words.definition: perfect
examples: This house is ideal for a small family.
She is the ideal candidate for the job.

words.meaning: Bir iş arayan kişinin, yeni bir çalışan arayan kişiyle görüştüğü toplantılar
words.definition: meetings where a person looking for a job talks to the person who is looking for a new worker
examples: I had a job interview yesterday.
The interview process was very long.

words.meaning: İnternetteki reklamlar veya yorumlar
words.definition: ads or comments on the Internet
examples: I saw a job posting on the website.
There are many social media postings about the new product.

words.meaning: Bir kişinin eğitim durumu ve önceki iş deneyimlerinin yazılı açıklamaları
words.definition: written descriptions of people's education and previous jobs
examples: I sent my resume to several companies.
Your resume should highlight your skills and experience.

words.meaning: İş karşılığında elde edilen iyi şeyler (para veya sağlık sigortası gibi)
words.definition: good things you get in return for work (such as money or health insurance)
examples: The company offers a variety of rewards to its employees.
Winning the award was a great reward for all our hard work.

words.meaning: Bir şeyin gerçekleştiği yer
words.definition: the place where something happens
examples: The setting of the novel is a small town in England.
The office setting is very casual.

words.meaning: İyi yapabildiğiniz şeyler; öğrendiğiniz ve pratik yaptığınız yetenekler
words.definition: things that you can do well; abilities that you have learned and practiced
examples: He has excellent communication skills.
To be successful in this job, you need strong technical skills.

words.meaning: Kendi işini yürütmek
words.definition: to start and manage your own company
examples: He wants to run his own business and be his own boss.
Starting a business is not easy, but it can be very rewarding.

words.meaning: Deneyim, yaşanmışlık
words.definition: knowledge or skill that comes from having done something for a period of time
examples: She has ten years of experience in marketing.
I learned a lot from my experience working abroad.

words.meaning: Zorluk, meydan okuma
words.definition: a difficult task or problem
examples: Starting a business is a big challenge.
I like to challenge myself to learn new things.

words.definition: joining or mixing two or more things together
words.meaning: İki veya daha fazla şeyi bir araya getirmek
examples: She is combining her art skills with technology to create something new.
By combining different ingredients, we can make a delicious meal.

words.definition: to make something new or original
words.meaning: Yeni veya özgün bir şey ortaya çıkarmak
examples: The artist created a beautiful painting.
We need to create a solution to this problem.

words.definition: eager to learn or know more about something
words.meaning: Bir şey hakkında daha fazla öğrenmeye istekli
examples: Children are naturally curious about the world.
She is curious to know how the machine works.

words.definition: to give support or confidence to someone
words.meaning: Birine destek vermek veya özgüven aşılamak
examples: Parents should encourage their children to read more.
The teacher encourages students to ask questions.

words.definition: something that is known to be true
words.meaning: Doğru olduğu bilinen bir şey
examples: It is a fact that the Earth revolves around the Sun.
Please check your facts before making a statement.

words.definition: making sense based on reason and facts
words.meaning: Mantık ve gerçeklere dayalı olarak anlamlı olan
examples: His explanation was very logical and easy to understand.
We need a logical approach to solve this problem.

words.definition: to find the size, amount, or degree of something
words.meaning: Bir şeyin boyutunu, miktarını veya derecesini bulmak
examples: The carpenter measured the room before installing the carpet.
Scientists measure the temperature of the ocean.

words.definition: new and different from anything else
words.meaning: Yeni ve diğer her şeyden farklı olan
examples: She always has original ideas for her projects.
This is an original painting by Van Gogh.

words.definition: a part of something larger
words.meaning: Daha büyük bir şeyin parçası
examples: I need a piece of paper to write this down.
The puzzle is missing one piece.

words.definition: to show that something is true
words.meaning: Bir şeyin doğru olduğunu göstermek
examples: The scientist proved his theory through experiments.
You need to prove that you can handle this responsibility.

words.definition: to find an answer or solution to a problem
words.meaning: Bir problemin cevabını veya çözümünü bulmak
examples: The detective solved the mystery.
Working together, we can solve this problem.

words.definition: to learn about something by reading and researching
words.meaning: Okuyarak ve araştırarak bir şey hakkında bilgi edinmek
examples: She studies biology at the university.
You need to study hard to pass the exam.

words.definition: to concentrate attention or effort on something
words.meaning: Dikkat veya çabayı bir şey üzerine yoğunlaştırmak
examples: You need to focus on your work and avoid distractions.
The company is focusing on developing new products.

words.definition: to do something that might have unpleasant or unwanted results
words.meaning: Hoş olmayan veya istenmeyen sonuçları olabilecek bir şey yapmak
examples: Entrepreneurs often have to take risks to succeed.
Sometimes you need to take risks to achieve your goals.

words.definition: to take someone to a police station because they may have committed a crime
words.meaning: Birini suç işlemiş olabileceği için polis merkezine götürmek
examples: The police arrested the suspect yesterday.
He was arrested for speeding and driving without a license.

words.definition: a piece of paper money
words.meaning: Kağıt para
examples: He paid with a hundred-dollar bill.
The cashier checked if the bill was real.

words.definition: totally, entirely
words.meaning: Bütünüyle, tamamıyla
examples: The project is completely finished.
I completely agree with your opinion.

words.definition: someone who illegally copies money or other items
words.meaning: Para veya başka eşyaları yasadışı olarak kopyalayan kişi
examples: The police caught a counterfeiter printing fake money.
Counterfeiters use sophisticated equipment to make fake bills.

words.definition: the tools or machines needed for a particular purpose
words.meaning: Belirli bir amaç için gereken araç veya makineler
examples: The gym has new exercise equipment.
You need special equipment to climb mountains.

words.definition: not real; made to look like something real
words.meaning: Gerçek olmayan; gerçeğine benzetilmiş
examples: The police discovered fake passports.
She could tell the handbag was fake.

words.definition: not allowed by law
words.meaning: Kanunlara aykırı olan
examples: It's illegal to drive without a license.
Selling counterfeit goods is illegal.

words.definition: colored liquid used for writing, printing, or drawing
words.meaning: Yazı yazmak, basmak veya çizmek için kullanılan renkli sıvı
examples: The printer is running out of ink.
She writes her letters with blue ink.

words.definition: worried or anxious about something
words.meaning: Endişeli veya kaygılı
examples: She feels nervous before every presentation.
The suspect looked nervous during questioning.

words.definition: to stop something from happening
words.meaning: Bir şeyin olmasını engellemek
examples: Regular exercise helps prevent health problems.
The security system prevents unauthorized access.

words.definition: a device that copies documents or images into a computer
words.meaning: Belgeleri veya görüntüleri bilgisayara kopyalayan cihaz
examples: Use the scanner to make a digital copy of the document.
Modern scanners can produce very high-quality images.

words.definition: scientific knowledge used in practical ways
words.meaning: Pratik yollarda kullanılan bilimsel bilgi
examples: New technology has changed the way we communicate.
The company invests heavily in technology.

words.definition: to do something illegal
words.meaning: Yasadışı bir şey yapmak
examples: Speeding breaks the law.
Anyone who breaks the law must face the consequences.

words.definition: having or showing good manners
words.meaning: İyi davranışlar gösteren veya sahip olan
examples: She is always polite to everyone she meets.
It's polite to say thank you when someone helps you.

words.definition: to make a place untidy by leaving waste products lying around
words.meaning: Etrafta çöp bırakarak bir yeri kirletmek
examples: Please don't litter in the park.
There are fines for littering on the street.

words.definition: to wait until it is your time to do something
words.meaning: Bir şey yapmak için kendi zamanını beklemek
examples: You must wait your turn to speak in class.
Everyone has to wait their turn at the doctor's office.

words.definition: not showing good manners; rude
words.meaning: İyi davranışlar göstermeyen; nezaketsiz
examples: It's impolite to talk with your mouth full.
He was being impolite by interrupting everyone.

words.definition: welcomed someone with particular words or actions
words.meaning: Birini belirli söz veya davranışlarla karşılamak
examples: She greeted her guests at the door.
We greeted each other with a handshake.

words.definition: extra money given to someone who has provided a service
words.meaning: Hizmet veren birine verilen ekstra para
examples: Don't forget to leave a tip for the waiter.
He always gives a generous tip to the taxi driver.

words.definition: to wait in a queue
words.meaning: Kuyrukta beklemek
examples: We stood in line for an hour to buy tickets.
People stood in line patiently at the bus stop.

words.definition: to obey the established guidelines or regulations
words.meaning: Belirlenmiş yönerge veya düzenlemelere uymak
examples: Students who followed the rules were rewarded.
Everyone must follow the rules of the game.

words.definition: to disobey or violate established guidelines
words.meaning: Belirlenmiş yönergelere uymamak veya ihlal etmek
examples: He broke the rules and was disqualified.
Students who break the rules face consequences.

words.definition: not permitted by the regulations
words.meaning: Düzenlemelere göre izin verilmeyen
examples: Running in the hallway is against the rules.
It's against the rules to use phones during the exam.

words.definition: a case where a rule does not apply
words.meaning: Bir kuralın geçerli olmadığı durum
examples: There are always exceptions to the rule.
In this case, we'll make an exception to the rule.

words.definition: slightly angry or irritated
words.meaning: Hafif kızgın veya sinirlenmiş
examples: She was annoyed by the loud noise.
The constant interruptions made him feel annoyed.

words.definition: to stop something from moving or passing through
words.meaning: Bir şeyin hareketini veya geçişini durdurmak
examples: The fallen tree blocked the road.
The spam filter blocks unwanted emails.

words.definition: polite and well-mannered; culturally advanced
words.meaning: Kibar ve görgülü; kültürel olarak gelişmiş
examples: They had a civilized discussion about their differences.
The restaurant offers a civilized dining experience.

words.definition: unable to think clearly or understand something
words.meaning: Net düşünemeyen veya bir şeyi anlayamayan
examples: The students were confused by the complex math problem.
I'm confused about which direction to take.

words.definition: old or aging
words.meaning: Yaşlı veya yaşlanan
examples: The elderly couple takes a walk every morning.
This program helps elderly people live independently.

words.definition: to make sure that rules or laws are obeyed
words.meaning: Kural veya yasalara uyulmasını sağlamak
examples: Police officers enforce traffic laws.
The school strictly enforces its dress code.

words.definition: the rules for polite behavior in society
words.meaning: Toplumda kibar davranış kuralları
examples: Business etiquette varies from country to country.
She teaches dining etiquette to corporate professionals.

words.definition: someone who has special knowledge or skill in a subject
words.meaning: Bir konuda özel bilgi veya beceriye sahip kişi
examples: He is an expert in computer security.
We consulted an expert for advice.

words.definition: polite ways of behaving with other people
words.meaning: Başkalarıyla kibar davranış şekilleri
examples: Good manners are important in every culture.
She taught her children proper table manners.

words.definition: a long, thin piece of wood or metal that stands upright
words.meaning: Dik duran uzun, ince tahta veya metal parça
examples: The flag waves from a tall pole.
They installed new light poles along the street.

words.definition: to move something by pressing against it
words.meaning: Bir şeye bastırarak hareket ettirmek
examples: Push the door to open it.
He pushed through the crowd to reach the exit.

words.definition: not polite; showing bad manners
words.meaning: Kibar olmayan; kötü davranış gösteren
examples: It's rude to interrupt when someone is speaking.
The customer was very rude to the waiter.

words.definition: to suddenly force air out through your nose and mouth
words.meaning: Aniden burun ve ağızdan hava çıkarmak
examples: Cover your mouth when you sneeze.
Dust makes me sneeze.

words.definition: to clear your nose by forcing air through it
words.meaning: Burnundan hava üfleyerek temizlemek
examples: Use a tissue to blow your nose.
It's polite to excuse yourself when you need to blow your nose.

words.definition: to look directly into someone's eyes while communicating
words.meaning: İletişim kurarken birinin gözlerine doğrudan bakmak
examples: It's important to make eye contact with your interviewer.
She made eye contact with everyone in the audience during her speech.

words.definition: to need or depend on someone or something
words.meaning: Birine veya bir şeye ihtiyaç duymak veya bağlı olmak
examples: You can rely on me to help you.
Many businesses rely on computer technology.

words.definition: the way you notice or understand something using your senses
words.meaning: Duyularınızı kullanarak bir şeyi fark etme veya anlama şekli
examples: People's perception of danger can vary greatly.
The optical illusion changes our perception of reality.

words.definition: the ability to see; sight
words.meaning: Görme yeteneği; görme duyusu
examples: Regular eye check-ups help maintain good vision.
Her vision became blurry without her glasses.

words.definition: the situation in which something happens
words.meaning: Bir şeyin gerçekleştiği durum veya ortam
examples: The word has a different meaning in this context.
You need to understand the historical context.

words.definition: the things, conditions, or influences around someone or something
words.meaning: Bir kişi veya şeyin etrafındaki şeyler, koşullar veya etkiler
examples: The hotel has beautiful surrounding gardens.
Animals adapt to their surrounding environment.

words.definition: curved pieces of glass or plastic used to see better or take photographs
words.meaning: Daha iyi görmek veya fotoğraf çekmek için kullanılan kavisli cam veya plastik parçalar
examples: She needs to clean her contact lenses daily.
The camera has multiple lenses for different types of shots.

words.definition: something that influences or causes a situation
words.meaning: Bir durumu etkileyen veya oluşturan şey
examples: Stress is a major factor in many health problems.
Price is an important factor when buying a car.

words.definition: the five natural powers (sight, hearing, touch, taste, and smell) that help you understand the world
words.meaning: Dünyayı anlamanıza yardımcı olan beş doğal güç (görme, işitme, dokunma, tat alma ve koku alma)
examples: Dogs have very sharp senses.
Our senses help us understand our environment.

words.definition: to influence or cause a change in something or someone
words.meaning: Bir şeyi veya birini etkilemek veya değişikliğe neden olmak
examples: Lack of sleep can affect your concentration.
The weather affects my mood.

words.definition: to think about something carefully
words.meaning: Bir şey hakkında dikkatlice düşünmek
examples: Please consider all options before making a decision.
They are considering moving to another city.

words.definition: to be very interested in or attracted by something
words.meaning: Bir şeye çok ilgi duyan veya çekilen
examples: Children are often fascinated by animals.
She was fascinated by the ancient ruins.

words.definition: a picture or visual representation of something
words.meaning: Bir şeyin resmi veya görsel temsili
examples: The telescope captured clear images of the planet.
She uploaded the image to her social media account.

words.definition: to explain the meaning of something
words.meaning: Bir şeyin anlamını açıklamak
examples: The doctor helped interpret the test results.
It's difficult to interpret body language correctly.

words.definition: something said or done to make people laugh
words.meaning: İnsanları güldürmek için söylenen veya yapılan şey
examples: He always tells jokes to lighten the mood.
Everyone laughed at her joke.

words.definition: a statement that makes something clear or easy to understand
words.meaning: Bir şeyi açık veya anlaşılır hale getiren ifade
examples: The teacher gave a clear explanation of the concept.
I need an explanation for why you're late.

words.definition: an exciting or dangerous experience
words.meaning: Heyecan verici veya tehlikeli bir deneyim
examples: They went on an adventure in the Amazon rainforest.
Reading books can take you on amazing adventures.

words.definition: likely to cause harm or injury
words.meaning: Zarar veya yaralanmaya neden olabilecek
examples: It's dangerous to drive in heavy snow.
Swimming in this area is dangerous due to strong currents.

words.definition: to win against someone in a fight, game, or competition
words.meaning: Bir kavga, oyun veya yarışmada birine karşı kazanmak
examples: Our team defeated the champions in the final match.
The army was defeated in the battle.

words.definition: to not succeed in achieving something
words.meaning: Bir şeyi başarmakta yetersiz kalmak
examples: He failed his driving test three times.
The business failed due to poor management.

words.definition: the ability to learn, understand and think in a logical way
words.meaning: Öğrenme, anlama ve mantıklı düşünme yeteneği
examples: She showed great intelligence in solving the problem.
Artificial intelligence is changing the world.

words.definition: an act of traveling from one place to another
words.meaning: Bir yerden başka bir yere seyahat etme eylemi
examples: The journey to the mountain top took three days.
Life is a journey of continuous learning.

words.definition: special powers that can make impossible things happen
words.meaning: İmkansız şeylerin olmasını sağlayabilen özel güçler
examples: The magician performed amazing magic tricks.
The story is full of magic and mystery.

words.definition: an experienced person who advises and helps someone with less experience
words.meaning: Daha az deneyimli birine tavsiye veren ve yardım eden deneyimli kişi
examples: She found a great mentor in her first job.
A good mentor can help guide your career.

words.definition: a chance to do something or a situation that makes it possible to do something
words.meaning: Bir şey yapma şansı veya bir şeyi mümkün kılan durum
examples: He took the opportunity to study abroad.
This job offers many opportunities for advancement.

words.definition: to keep someone or something safe from harm or damage
words.meaning: Birini veya bir şeyi zarardan veya hasardan güvende tutmak
examples: Parents want to protect their children from danger.
Sunscreen helps protect your skin from the sun.

words.definition: the state of being safe and protected from danger or harm
words.meaning: Tehlike veya zarardan güvende ve korunmuş olma durumu
examples: Safety is our top priority in this workplace.
Always check the safety instructions before using new equipment.

words.definition: to try very hard to do something difficult
words.meaning: Zor bir şeyi yapmak için çok çabalamak
examples: Many students struggle with mathematics.
He struggled to carry all the heavy boxes.

words.definition: to achieve something that you have been trying to do
words.meaning: Yapmaya çalıştığınız bir şeyi gerçekleştirmek
examples: She worked hard and succeeded in getting the promotion.
Not everyone who tries will succeed, but everyone can learn from trying.

words.definition: valuable things, such as gold, jewels or money
words.meaning: Altın, mücevher veya para gibi değerli şeyler
examples: Pirates searched for buried treasure on the island.
These old photographs are family treasures.

words.definition: medicine that kills bacteria and cures infections
words.meaning: Bakterileri öldüren ve enfeksiyonları iyileştiren ilaç
examples: The doctor prescribed antibiotics for the infection.
Always complete the full course of antibiotics.

words.definition: a strip of material used to cover and protect a wound
words.meaning: Yarayı örtmek ve korumak için kullanılan malzeme şeridi
examples: She put a bandage on the cut.
The nurse changed the bandage daily.

words.definition: the red liquid that flows through the body
words.meaning: Vücutta dolaşan kırmızı sıvı
examples: The doctor took a blood sample for testing.
Regular exercise improves blood circulation.

words.definition: to make someone healthy again after an illness
words.meaning: Birini hastalıktan sonra tekrar sağlıklı hale getirmek
examples: Scientists are working to find a cure for cancer.
Rest and proper medication helped cure his illness.

words.definition: a body temperature that is higher than normal
words.meaning: Normalden yüksek vücut sıcaklığı
examples: The child has a high fever.
Take medicine to reduce the fever.

words.definition: to move in a continuous stream
words.meaning: Sürekli bir akış halinde hareket etmek
examples: Blood flows through our veins.
The river flows into the sea.

words.definition: in a careful and soft way
words.meaning: Dikkatli ve yumuşak bir şekilde
examples: Clean the wound gently with antiseptic.
She gently applied the cream to her skin.

words.definition: a person who is receiving medical treatment
words.meaning: Tıbbi tedavi gören kişi
examples: The doctor examined the patient carefully.
The patient is recovering well after surgery.

words.definition: liked or admired by many people
words.meaning: Çok kişi tarafından sevilen veya beğenilen
examples: Yoga is becoming increasingly popular as a form of exercise.
This is a popular treatment for back pain.

words.definition: to become less tense or anxious
words.meaning: Daha az gergin veya endişeli hale gelmek
examples: Deep breathing helps you relax.
Try to relax your muscles during the massage.

words.definition: the liquid naturally produced in the mouth
words.meaning: Ağızda doğal olarak üretilen sıvı
examples: Saliva helps break down food during digestion.
The test requires a saliva sample.

words.definition: an injection of medicine
words.meaning: İlaç enjeksiyonu
examples: Children need several shots to prevent diseases.
The flu shot helps prevent influenza.

words.definition: an area of the body that has become larger or puffed up
words.meaning: Vücudun büyümüş veya şişmiş bir bölgesi
examples: Ice can help reduce swelling.
There was some swelling around the injured ankle.

words.definition: enlarged, puffed up
words.meaning: Büyümüş, kabarmış
examples: Her ankle was swollen after the fall.
Apply ice to the swollen area.

words.definition: to give medical care to cure an illness or injury
words.meaning: Bir hastalığı veya yaralanmayı iyileştirmek için tıbbi bakım vermek
examples: The doctor knows how to treat this condition.
It's important to treat the infection early.

words.definition: a blood vessel that carries blood to the heart
words.meaning: Kanı kalbe taşıyan kan damarı
examples: The nurse had trouble finding a vein for the injection.
Exercise helps improve blood flow in your veins.

words.definition: pain or discomfort in the throat
words.meaning: Boğazda ağrı veya rahatsızlık
examples: She has a sore throat and can't swallow easily.
Warm tea with honey can help with a sore throat.

words.definition: a pain in the head
words.meaning: Başta hissedilen ağrı
examples: Stress can cause headaches.
She took aspirin for her headache.

words.definition: pain in the stomach or abdomen
words.meaning: Mide veya karında hissedilen ağrı
examples: He got a stomachache after eating too much.
The child complained of a stomachache.

words.definition: pain inside the ear
words.meaning: Kulak içinde hissedilen ağrı
examples: Swimming can sometimes cause earaches.
The child woke up with an earache.

words.definition: pain in or around a tooth
words.meaning: Diş içinde veya çevresinde hissedilen ağrı
examples: A cavity can cause a toothache.
She couldn't sleep because of her toothache.

words.definition: pain in the back
words.meaning: Sırtta hissedilen ağrı
examples: Lifting heavy objects can cause backache.
Regular exercise can help prevent backache.

words.definition: an injury to the ankle caused by twisting it
words.meaning: Ayak bileğinin burkulması sonucu oluşan yaralanma
examples: She got a sprained ankle while playing basketball.
Rest and ice can help heal a sprained ankle.

words.definition: a common illness that causes fever, weakness, and body aches
words.meaning: Ateş, halsizlik ve vücut ağrılarına neden olan yaygın bir hastalık
examples: Many people get the flu during winter.
He missed work because he had the flu.

words.definition: to change in order to deal with new situations
words.meaning: Yeni durumlara uyum sağlamak için değişmek
examples: Animals must adapt to survive climate change.
It took time to adapt to living in a new country.

words.definition: a person in your family who lived a long time ago
words.meaning: Ailenizde uzun zaman önce yaşamış kişi
examples: Our ancestors came from Europe 200 years ago.
Scientists study human ancestors to understand evolution.

words.definition: to join or link two or more things together
words.meaning: İki veya daha fazla şeyi birbirine birleştirmek
examples: The bridge connects two islands.
Social media helps people connect with friends.

words.definition: to make someone believe something is true
words.meaning: Birinin bir şeyin doğru olduğuna inanmasını sağlamak
examples: She convinced her parents to let her study abroad.
The evidence convinced the jury of his innocence.

words.definition: to damage something so badly that it no longer exists or cannot be repaired
words.meaning: Bir şeyi artık var olmayacak veya tamir edilemeyecek kadar kötü hasara uğratmak
examples: The fire destroyed the entire building.
Pollution is destroying our environment.

words.definition: at risk of disappearing forever
words.meaning: Sonsuza dek yok olma riski altında olan
examples: Tigers are an endangered species.
Many endangered animals live in the rainforest.

words.definition: moving from place to place rather than living in one place
words.meaning: Bir yerde yaşamak yerine sürekli yer değiştiren
examples: Nomadic tribes follow their herds across the grasslands.
Some people choose a nomadic lifestyle.

words.definition: having great power, influence, or strength
words.meaning: Büyük güce, etkiye veya kuvvete sahip olan
examples: The storm was very powerful.
She is one of the most powerful leaders in the world.

words.definition: to express strong disagreement with something
words.meaning: Bir şeye karşı güçlü anlaşmazlığını ifade etmek
examples: Students protested against the new rules.
People gathered to protest environmental pollution.

words.definition: the origins or background of something
words.meaning: Bir şeyin kökeni veya geçmişi
examples: She's trying to learn about her family roots.
The music has its roots in African culture.

words.definition: to make a place your permanent home
words.meaning: Bir yeri kalıcı ev yapmak
examples: Many immigrants settled in the new country.
They decided to settle in a small coastal town.

words.definition: to continue to live or exist
words.meaning: Yaşamaya veya var olmaya devam etmek
examples: Few plants can survive in the desert.
The company survived the economic crisis.

words.definition: being the only one of its kind
words.meaning: Türünün tek örneği olan
examples: Every person's fingerprints are unique.
The island has many unique species of plants.

words.definition: requiring immediate action or attention
words.meaning: Hemen harekete geçilmesi veya ilgilenilmesi gereken
examples: This is an urgent message from the hospital.
Climate change requires urgent action.
